specification.name: webhook.http
specification.description:
A processor that sends an HTTP request to the specified URL, retries on error and 
saves the response body and, optionally, the response status.
specification.author: Meroxa, Inc.

backoffRetry.count.description:
BackoffRetryCount is the maximum number of retries for an individual record
when backing off following an error.

backoffRetry.factor.description: BackoffRetryFactor is the multiplying factor for each increment step.

backoffRetry.max.description: BackoffRetryMax is the maximum waiting time before retrying.

backoffRetry.min.description: BackoffRetryMin is the minimum waiting time before retrying.

request.body.description:
RequestBodyRef specifies which field from the input record
should be used as the body in the HTTP request.
The value of this parameter should be a valid record field reference:
See: sdk.NewReferenceResolver

request.contentType.description: ContentType is the value of the Content-Type header.

request.method.description: Method is the HTTP request method to be used.

request.url.description: URL used in the HTTP request.

response.body.description:
ResponseBodyRef specifies to which field should the
response body be saved to.
The value of this parameter should be a valid record field reference:
See: sdk.NewReferenceResolver

response.status.description:
ResponseStatusRef specifies to which field should the
response status be saved to.
The value of this parameter should be a valid record field reference.
If no value is set, then the response status will NOT be saved.
See: sdk.NewReferenceResolver

examples.summary: Send a request to an HTTP server
examples.description:
This example shows how to use the HTTP processor to send a record's .Payload.After field to a dummy HTTP server
that replies back with a greeting.

The record's .Payload.After is overwritten with the response. Additionally, the example shows how to store the
value of the HTTP response's code in the metadata field http_status.
